Super impressed! The documentation process was incredibly quick and effortless. All my mutual funds were auto-loaded from the central repository, requiring zero manual effort. The best part was that it even retrieved some of my old mutual funds that I no longer had records of. I also raised a redemption request, which was processed swiftly. If the payout is completed within the estimated timeline, this would be an outstanding overall experience.

Groww is one of the smoothest and easiest apps for beginners in trading and investing. The interface is clean, buying and selling stocks is simple, and GTT orders make it beginner-friendly. However, the app still needs a few advanced features like stop-loss take-profit for delivery trades and trailing stop-loss options for swing traders. Adding those would make Groww perfect for both new and active users. Overall, its great for starting out, learning, and building a long-term portfolio

Groww is a great app for investments, but it lacks an important feature the ability to create separate folders or sections for different holdings like stocks and ETFs. Having this would help users organize their portfolios better and track investments more easily. I hope Groww adds this feature soon to make portfolio management more convenient for investors.

I am writing to report a persistent bug I've encountered within the app. When I place a trade order, especially for a larger quantity (e.g., 50-60 lots), the app enters a prolonged loading state. This issue occurs regardless of whether I am connected to a 5G cellular network or 5G Wi-Fi. This loading significantly hinders my ability to monitor my trades and manage my funds effectively, as I am left without real-time information during this critical period.
I ask one question how I can understand I have invested in appropriate company.... where is AMC report?

A very user friendly app. Simple jobs for investors are way easily done. SIP monitor and the dashboard are great help and money handling through UPI and net banking is swift. There is a lag in the orders in MF closer to EOD as it may get in on the next day. Not used trading so cannot comment. One suggestion is that while scrolling list of stocks or MF, the current holding should show up below the relevant stock. it will assist comparisons one wishes to make.
